messages.content:
You are an AI assistant specialized in analyzing web projects developed using PHP and the Laravel framework. I need to generate an OpenAPI Specification for a web project based on its backend source code. I'm now focusing on endpoint `/{users}/users/{user}` with method GET, and here is the relevant information I found:

1. In `app/Http/Controllers/Admin/UserController.php`, `App\\Http\\Controllers\\Admin\\UserController::class` is implemented to process HTTP requests to `/{users}/users/{user}` with HTTP method GET.

I'll provide you with the contents of the files mentioned above, you have the option to execute additional Unix commands to gather more information if necessary, but you must not run the source code of the project, and your task is to generate a list of Parameter Objects (the value of paths.[endpoint].[method].parameters) in Swagger 2.0 format.

You need to think step by step and provide an explanation of your results first. Then, output exactly "the final generated result begins" (I will split your output and then do json parse, so you must output it and do not change it), followed by the list of Parameter Objects in JSON format. Do not include fields not mentioned above, and do not use references ($ref) in your output (try to obtain the structure by executing additional Unix commands).

function.name: run_command
function.description: Run a Unix command and get outputs in the project directory. You must not run any source code of the project.

message.content:
Okay, I need to generate the Parameter Objects for the GET method of the `/{users}/users/{user}` endpoint based on the provided code.

The code provided only contains the `index`, `edit`, and `update` methods of the `UserController`. The `edit` method seems to be the most relevant one, as it receives a `User $user` parameter, which likely corresponds to the `{user}` part of the endpoint.

To confirm this and to understand how the `{user}` parameter is used, I'll use the `run_command` to check the routes defined in the project. This will help me understand how the route is defined and if there are any parameters.
